poem:
### Departures

In the early light,  
a desk cleared, a room left behind—  
labels like "motherly" and "aggressive"  
dropped on the floor like clothes  
we no longer wish to wear.  
Out the door, a breath drawn deep,  
the horizon mysteriously wide,  
losing only what we never needed  
to become the self we truly are.
